mods.abstract: Small Pre-Columbian vessel with a restricted rim. Four nodules incised with alternating slated lines protrude from the shoulder. Extending from the rim are two animal-like head appliqués with punctated features, which may represent turtle or bird figures. Legs are wide where they attach to the vessel and come to a point.
One leg is missing, and a thin outline of its impression remains. Roughly half of the rim is cracked and missing. One of the head appliqués appears to have broken off and been glued back on.

titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian vessels
Pre-Columbian cultural artifacts
George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
